benchmark_details.name: CAMPHOR Dataset
benchmark_details.overview: The CAMPHOR dataset contains multi-agent execution trajectories focused on mobile assistant use cases, annotated to demonstrate how a multi-agent system fetches personal information to solve user queries by breaking down tasks into smaller actions.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a dataset for training and evaluating on-device Small Language Models (SLMs) in multi-agent planning and personalized query understanding.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The personalized user query parsing task is restricted to single interactions, oversimplifying the problem space.

data.source: The data is generated using GPT-4o based on a device state and global function definitions to create user queries and their respective function call trajectories.
data.annotation: Annotated with human oversight and simulation of personal device states to capture task completion trajectories.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the accuracy of function names and parameters in task completion calls.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better accuracy in executing function calls as per user intent.
methodology.baseline_results: Fine-tuned SLMs outperform state-of-the-art LLMs in task completion metrics.
methodology.validation: The dataset includes a validation set and metrics were evaluated against both LLM baselines and fine-tuned SLMs.
